title: Network & Affiliations
text: My academic journey is built on strong collaborations with leading research institutions and a vibrant network of brilliant colleagues.

title: Network & Affiliations
text:
Research Institutions & Groups



University of Naples Federico II
PhD & Research Home The oldest public non-sectarian university in the world, where I conduct my primary research in Economics and Statistics.


Department of Economics and Statistics
DISES My home department, a hub of excellence for economic and statistical research in Southern Italy.




Naples School of Economics (NSE)
PhD Program An international PhD program fostering advanced research in economics and finance.


Leiden University
Visiting Scholar Department of Methodology and Statistics. I spent a visiting period here focusing on psychometrics and statistical learning.




Bibliometrix
Core Developer Team An open-source R-tool for comprehensive science mapping analysis. I contribute to the development and maintenance of the package.


K-Synth
Academic Spin-off A spin-off of Federico II University focused on synthetic data generation and advanced statistical consulting.

title: Research
text: My research activity focuses on Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI), Machine Learning, and Bibliometrics, with a specific interest in developing interpretable structures for Random Forests and Ensemble Trees.

title: Agostino Gnasso
text:
Email
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  
  
    
     GitHub
  
  
    
     Scholar
  
  
    
     ResearchGate
  

      
I hold a Ph.D.¬†in Economics from the University of Naples Federico II, where I specialize in an interdisciplinary blend of Statistical Analysis, Machine Learning, and Economics. My academic journey is rooted in the pursuit of clarity and effectiveness within the rapidly evolving field of data science.


My research primarily explores the interpretability of algorithms, specifically in the fields of Explainable Machine Learning (XML) and Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI). As machine learning models become increasingly integral to critical decision-making in sectors like finance and healthcare, the necessity for transparency is paramount. My work aims to make these powerful tools more understandable and accessible, with a keen interest in decision-tree methods appreciated for their simplicity and ease interpretation.



I am currently a member of the Bibliometrix Research Team and the academic spin-off K-Synth. Recently, I worked as a Visiting Scholar at the Department of Methodology and Statistics at Leiden University (Netherlands).
My contributions have been recognized in publications in several international scientific journals. Alongside a talented team of colleagues, I actively work on developing innovative open-source software packages for the R programming environment.

title: Agostino Gnasso
text:
Research Interests

Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI)
Machine Learning & Ensemble models
Bibliometrics & Science Mapping
Statistical Software Development (R & Python)
